ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 12 This course took too much time. It was more than any class should take.
10 hours
This is a difficult question to answer, as the weeks varied quite a lot.
overall, maybe 10
vary greatly, from very little at the beginning to 3-5 hours at the end.
At least 10. Sometimes up to 25.
5 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This class took much time outside of class. There were too many assignments apart from our main group project. We had 2 five hour classes which were stressful.

A LOT OF WORK! SHOULD BE MORE THAN ONE CREDIT!Strengths: team building skills, practical public health skillsWeaknesses: a lot of work, somewhat unorganized projects, assignments due almost every class, in class assessments, two 5 hour classes

It's very helpful to have this practicum experience during my first year of my MPH (before summer internship). The project allowed me to integrate learned classroom skills from my other courses into a real project for a real organization for a real community.Class time seemed a little drawn out at times, not always helpful. A lot of the teamwork material is stuff that graduate level students should already know and have experience with.For me, the most beneficial part of the course was the project. However, I do expect that the benefits of the classroom portion of the course will become more apparent with time.

I think the biggest strength of the course is providing students an opportunity to build upon skills learned in the classroom in a real-world situation. I think the selection of projects was quite good, and with a broad enough range to interest students from different areas of interest.I do think that the biggest challenge is helping students to not spend the last two weeks scrambling to finish projects. It's difficult to juggle a pretty large workload in this class with final projects from other courses.
should be spread over two semesters or be more than 1 credit. I put SO MUCH time into it.

The course has a lot of class time itself and takes up a lot more outside class time. The structure of the course could change so that there is more class time devoted to group projects - could cut out the PSAs
This is a great opportunity to get practical experience and work with a group.
Very good experience. At times very work intensive. Very good to work in the community.

I am really glad that I took this course, I learned a ton from the real-world nature of the community based participatory research that my group completed. With our limited time frame, there was a lot of work for the project both at the beginning of the semester (IRB approval, budget, preceptor meetings, defining group tasks, creating a logic model etc) and at the end of the semester (data collection, data analysis, writing our final report, and presenting our findings). I feel that I gained the most skills during the final few weeks of the course once we had to synthesize all of the tools we had learned throughout the semester and our findings to generate a report.

The projects themselves can be very engaging but the class often fails to enrich of assist the projects in a meaningful way. Much of the time is spent on fairly rudimentary lessons on team dynamic which feel unnecessary.
The classes were lively and interactive. There were a lot of good discussions among students. It may have been better if it touched on building more concrete skill sets
Good class for those out of undergrad

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Great person.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Very knowledgeable professor. She gives great feedback on work and assignments.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie has lots of experience in program planning and it is clear that bits of her expertise got passed along during class.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Dr. Humphries was great--hands off enough to empower students to figure out their projects, but accessible when need be.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  she was fine
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Dr. Humphries is a great instructor and is excellent at stimulating discussion. She is very attentive to students and did an excellent job with the course!
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Dr. Humphries is available to provide feedback/advice. She is very passionate bout the material
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Prof. Humphries was knowledgeable and very receptive to feedback.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie is very passionate about the course and that definitely came through in her teaching style. She is very open and interested in student feedback and it seems that the course has evolved quite a bit over the years. I would suggest that some of the course content could be presented more efficiently (perhaps only one five hour class session instead of two).
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  was very helpful to students. She tried her best to help with all groups of students to make progress with their projects smoothly and always made time for students.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Amelia Ruth Reese  TA was helpful
Instructor: Amelia Ruth Reese  Amelia was great! Super nice and helpful.
Instructor: Amelia Ruth Reese  Amelia was helpful and accessible. Overall really good job.
Instructor: Amelia Ruth Reese  she was great
Instructor: Amelia Ruth Reese  Amelia was great about responding to questions.

Instructor: Margaret Wheeler Lippitt  Very prompt, very helpful, always on top of things (at times when we sometimes were not!). Her input was extremely valuable and she provided excellent guidance for us along the way. Thank you, Margaret!
Instructor: Margaret Wheeler Lippitt  Margaret is a rock star! She was great at answering all out questions and went above and beyond in helping our project.

Instructor: Margaret Wheeler Lippitt  My group and I talked about how Margaret should win TA of the year! She was an exceptional TA to us all. She was very thoughtful in her advice regarding our project, incredibly responsive to email, and very well organized overall. She also took time to walk us through data analysis that she had learned in her own coursework that was relevant to our project. I think we all really benefited from having her as our TA.
Instructor: Neel Subramanian Iyer  -Project preceptor:-Responsive to emails and concerns. Willing to help with any hurdles in the process. Great TA.
Instructor: Neel Subramanian Iyer  Neel was very organized and very responsive. He offered thoughtful and effective advice.
Instructor: Neel Subramanian Iyer  was helpful

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: No. You will not have enough time to do anything else
Warning...avoid taking this class your first year, it is a lot to take with epi and biostats. A lot of work.

This is a great course for anyone desiring to work closely with an organization to see community planning in practice. I would recommend this course to students who are not overburdened with other obligations.
take it if you like group work, lots of work, and want hands on experience
The projects are rewarding and even fun to work on but it's hard to juggle 4 other courses and group schedules. I would recommend it to anyone interested in practical public health experience.
This course is very labor intensive, but a great practical experience. The class component can be tedious, but it's a trade-off to gain the practicum experience.
Very good way to get practical experience.

Overall, this course was great experience for throwing us into a real-world research setting, including many of the challenges that come with this process. The workload and skills gained from this course definitely came in spurts and I felt like it wasn't until the very end of the course that I really appreciated how much we had learned. I am definitely glad I took the course and would highly recommend it to anyone considering taking it.
would recommend it to students with strong interests in working with community partners.
